title: CVS and Walgreens Near $10 Billion Deal to Settle Opioid Cases
description: The dual agreements would resolve thousands of lawsuits over the retailersâ€™ role in the addiction crisis. But a large majority of state, local and tribal governments must sign on.
dc:creator: Jan Hoffman
media:credit: Jeenah Moon for The New York Times
media:description: CVS said that over the next 10 years, it would pay $4.9 billion to states and municipal governments and approximately $130 million to tribes.
